content:
DirectoryAttribute Class

Definition

The DirectoryAttribute class enables access to the attribute values.

In this Article

public class DirectoryAttribute : System.Collections.CollectionBase
Inheritance
Object
CollectionBase
DirectoryAttribute
Derived

Constructors

DirectoryAttribute()

The DirectoryAttribute constructor creates an instance of the DirectoryAttribute class.

public DirectoryAttribute ();

DirectoryAttribute(String, Byte[])

The DirectoryAttribute constructor creates an instance of the DirectoryAttribute class using the specified attribute name and value.

public DirectoryAttribute (string name, byte[] value);
Parameters
name
String

The attribute name.

value
Byte[]

The attribute value.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

name or value contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

DirectoryAttribute(String, Object[])

The DirectoryAttribute constructor creates an instance of the DirectoryAttribute class using the specified attribute name and values.

public DirectoryAttribute (string name, object[] values);
Parameters
name
String

The attribute name.

values
Object[]

An array of values for the attribute.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

name or value contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

ArgumentException

An element of values is not of type string, byte[], or Uri.

DirectoryAttribute(String, String)

The DirectoryAttribute constructor creates an instance of the DirectoryAttribute class using the specified attribute name and value.

public DirectoryAttribute (string name, string value);
Parameters
name
String

The attribute name.

value
String

The attribute value.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

name or value contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

DirectoryAttribute(String, Uri)

The DirectoryAttribute constructor creates an instance of the DirectoryAttribute class using the specified attribute name and value.

public DirectoryAttribute (string name, Uri value);
Parameters
name
String

The attribute name.

value
Uri

The attribute value.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

name or value contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Properties

Item(Int32)

The Item property gets or sets the DirectoryAttribute object at the specified index.

public object this[int index] { get; set; }
Parameters
index
Int32

The zero-based index value at which the DirectoryAttribute object is found.

Value
Object

The DirectoryAttribute object at the specified index.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

value to set is an invalid type. The valid types are byte[], string, or URI.

ArgumentNullException

value contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Remarks

The Get method of Item always attempts to convert and return the value object as a string; otherwise it returns a byte array. To get a better performance, use the GetValues method if you know the return type of the attribute value.

Name

The Name property contains the attribute name.

public string Name { get; set; }
Value
String

The attribute name.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

value contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Methods

Add(Byte[])

The Add method adds the specified value to this attribute.

public int Add (byte[] value);
Parameters
value
Byte[]

The value to add.

Returns
Int32

The index at which the value has been added.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

Value contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Add(String)

The Add method adds the specified value to this attribute.

public int Add (string value);
Parameters
value
String

The value to add.

Returns
Int32

The index at which the value has been added.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

Value contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Add(Uri)

The Add method adds the specified value to this attribute.

public int Add (Uri value);
Parameters
value
Uri

The value to add.

Returns
Int32

The index at which the value has been added.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

Value contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

AddRange(Object[])

The AddRange method adds an array of values to the attribute.

public void AddRange (object[] values);
Parameters
values
Object[]

The values to add.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

values is not a byte[][], string[], or Uri[].

ArgumentNullException

Values contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Contains(Object)

The Contains method determines if the attribute contains the specified value.

public bool Contains (object value);
Parameters
value
Object

The value for which to search.

Returns
Boolean

true if this attribute contains the value or false if it does not.

CopyTo(Object[], Int32)

The CopyTo method copies the entire collection to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.

public void CopyTo (object[] array, int index);
Parameters
array
Object[]

A one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the DirectoryAttribute object.

index
Int32

The zero-based index of array where the copying begins.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

array contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than zero.

ArgumentException

This exception can occur under one of the following conditions:

  • array is multidimensional

  • index is equal to, or greater than, the length of array

  • The number of elements in the source DirectoryControlCollection is greater than the space available from index to the end of the destination array.

InvalidCastException

The type of the source DirectoryControlCollection cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination array.

GetValues(Type)

The GetValues method returns all values of the specified type.

public object[] GetValues (Type valuesType);
Parameters
valuesType
Type

A Type object that specifies the type of values to return.

Returns
Object[]

An array of Object objects that contain the values.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

A value cannot be converted to valuesType.

ArgumentException

valuesType must be either string or byte.

IndexOf(Object)

The IndexOf method returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified Object in the DirectoryAttribute collection.

public int IndexOf (object value);
Parameters
value
Object

The Object for which the value is returned.

Returns
Int32

The index value of the specified Object, if found; otherwise, -1.

Insert(Int32, Byte[])

The Insert method inserts the specified value into the DirectoryAttribute collection at the specified index.

public void Insert (int index, byte[] value);
Parameters
index
Int32

The index in the DirectoryAttribute collection at which to insert the value.

value
Byte[]

The value to insert.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

value contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than zero, or index is greater than the number of elements in the DirectoryAttribute object.

Insert(Int32, String)

The Insert method inserts the specified value into the DirectoryAttribute collection at the specified index.

public void Insert (int index, string value);
Parameters
index
Int32

The index in the DirectoryAttribute collection at which to insert the value.

value
String

The value to insert.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

value contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than zero, or index is greater than the number of elements in the DirectoryAttribute object.

Insert(Int32, Uri)

The Insert method inserts the specified value into the DirectoryAttribute collection at the specified index.

public void Insert (int index, Uri value);
Parameters
index
Int32

The index in the DirectoryAttribute collection at which to insert the value.

value
Uri

The value to insert.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

value contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than zero or index is greater than the number of elements in the DirectoryAttribute object.

OnValidate(Object)

The OnValidate method verifies that value is a DirectoryAttribute object.

protected override void OnValidate (object value);
Parameters
value
Object

The Object to evaluate.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

value contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

ArgumentException

value must be either a string, byte[], or URI.

Remarks

This method does not return a value. Instead, an exception is thrown if the specified object is null or is an invalid DirectoryAttribute object.

Remove(Object)

The Remove method removes the first occurrence of the specified value from the list of attributes.

public void Remove (object value);
Parameters
value
Object

The Object to remove.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

value contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
